thread.title: Mariners, islanders, Panthers secure late-season wins
thread.title_full: Mariners, islanders, Panthers secure late-season wins

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Mariners, islanders, Panthers secure late-season wins
text:
View More... 
The regular season has reached its end for most high school boys and girls soccer teams, with the playoffs on the horizon for a select few. 
Though the Maine Principals' Association Heal Points will not be final until Wednesday, Oct. 21, it appears the Oceanside boys and girls, Vinalhaven boys and girls and Medomak Valley boys are playoff-bound, while the Panther girls will be on the outside looking in. 
The following is a recap of recently-reported results: 
Boys soccer 
Oceanside 5, Belfast 0 
At Rockland Oct. 19, the Mariners blanked the Lions to wrap the regular season. Oceanside led 3-0 at halftime. 
Titus Kaewthong and Christian Straka netted goals for Oceanside, while Sam Townsend added one goal and Cadden Lavoie and Alden Mason one assist. 
Coby Dorr made one save on one shot in net for Oceanside, while Max Lewis made nine saves on 17 shots in goal for Belfast. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Oceanside (10-2-2, 110.9949 points) is third. Ellsworth (10-2-1, 139.2092 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Medomak Valley 6, Maine Central Institute 0 
At Pittsfield Oct. 19, the Panthers blanked the Huskies en route to their ninth win. Medomak Valley led 2-0 at halftime. 
Leading the Panther offense were Tucker Prescott (2 goals), Cameron Leach (2 goals), Cale Gee (goal, assist), Alvaro Valls (goal, 2 assists) and Jackson Vail (assist). 
Medomak Valley held a 16-4 edge in shots. Zack Starr made three saves in the second half and Cameron Robinson one in the first in goal for the Panthers, while Aiden Peacock turned away 10 shots in net for the Huskies. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Medomak Valley (9-3-2, 92.0918 points) is seventh, while Ellsworth (10-2-1, 139.2092 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Rangeley 3, Vinalhaven/North Haven 0 
At Rangeley Oct. 17, the Lakers blanked the visiting islanders. 
The visitors held a 14-13 lead in shots, while the hosts led 4-3 in corner kicks. Isles Blackington made 12 saves in net for Vinalhaven/North Haven, while Tim White made nine saves in goal for Rangeley. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class D South, Vinalhaven/North Haven (4-7, 44.1558 points) is eighth, while Buckfield (12-1, 128.0500 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Vinalhaven/North Haven 3, Rangeley 2 
At Rangeley Oct. 16, the islanders netted a one-goal victory. The game was called with 14 minutes left in regulation due to darkness. 
Cody Hamilton, Lewis Cray and Ethan Anthony scored for the islanders, while Leo Perez and Loe Livera creased the net for the Lakers. 
Vinalhaven/North Haven held an 11-7 edge in shots. Isles Blackington made 11 saves in net for the islanders, while Tim White made eight saves in goal for Rangeley. 
Richmond 3, Vinalhaven/North Haven 1 
At Vinalhaven Oct. 9, the Bobcats emerged with a two-goal victory over the islanders. 
Lewis Cray scored the lone goal for Vinalhaven/North Haven in the losing effort. Richmond held a 13-9 edge in shots and a 2-1 edge in corner kicks. Isles Blackington made 11 saves in goal for the hosts, while Richmond's goalie, whose name was unavailable, made 10 saves. 
Buckfield 3, Vinalhaven/North Haven 0 
At Vinalhaven Oct. 3, The Bucks netted their second shutout over the islanders in as many days. 
Buckfield held a 24-8 lead in shots and a 3-2 edge in corner kicks. Isles Blackington made 18 saves in goal for the islanders, while Jacob Kraske made four saves in net for Buckfield. 
Buckfield 6, Vinalhaven/North Haven 0 
At Vinalhaven Oct. 2, the Bucks blanked the islanders. 
Buckfield held a 21-7 lead in shots, while Vinalhaven/North Haven held a 6-4 edge in corner kicks. Isles Blackington made 10 saves in goal for the hosts, while Jacob Kraske made four saves in net for the visitors. 
Girls soccer 
Medomak Valley 2, Maine Central Institute 1 (2OT) 
At Waldoboro Oct. 19, the Panthers prevailed in double-overtime over the visiting Huskies. 
Maggie Cox netted both goals in the win for Medomak Valley, with the first coming 10 minutes into the game and the second with 1:42 left in the second overtime. 
Chelsea Ripley made three saves on four shots in goal for Medomak Valley. Information on MCI was unavailable. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Medomak Valley (3-10-1, 24.2347 points) is 14th, while Oceanside of Rockland/Thomaston (12-0-2, 176.9133 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs.
